verses.verse: So these three<WH7969> men<WH582> ceased<WH7673> to answer<WH6030> Job<WH347>, because he was righteous<WH6662> in his own eyes<WH5869>. to: Heb. from answering

Then was kindled<WH2734> the wrath<WH639> of Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940>, of the kindred<WH4940> of Ram<WH7410>: against Job<WH347> was his wrath<WH639> kindled<WH2734>, because he justified<WH6663> himself<WH5315> rather than God<WH430>. himself: Heb. his soul
Also against his three<WH7969> friends<WH7453> was his wrath<WH639> kindled<WH2734>, because they had found<WH4672> no answer<WH4617>, and yet had condemned<WH7561> Job<WH347>.
Now Elihu<WH453> had waited<WH2442> till Job<WH347> had spoken<WH1697>, because they were elder<WH2205> <WH3117> than he. waited: Heb. expected Job in words elder: Heb. elder for days
When Elihu<WH453> saw<WH7200> that there was no answer<WH4617> in the mouth<WH6310> of these three<WH7969> men<WH582>, then his wrath<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>.

And Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, I am young<WH6810> <WH3117>, and ye are very old<WH3453>; wherefore I was afraid<WH2119>, and durst<WH3372> not shew<WH2331> you mine opinion<WH1843>. young: Heb. few of days durst: Heb. feared
I said<WH559>, Days<WH3117> should speak<WH1696>, and multitude<WH7230> of years<WH8141> should teach<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451>.
But<WH403> there is a spirit<WH7307> in man<WH582>: and the inspiration<WH5397> of the Almighty<WH7706> giveth them understanding<WH995>.
Great men<WH7227> are not always wise<WH2449>: neither do the aged<WH2205> understand<WH995> judgment<WH4941>.
Therefore I said<WH559>, Hearken<WH8085> to me; I also will shew<WH2331> mine opinion<WH1843>.
Behold, I waited<WH3176> for your words<WH1697>; I gave ear<WH238> to your reasons<WH8394>, whilst ye searched out<WH2713> what to say<WH4405>. reasons: Heb. understandings what: Heb. words
Yea, I attended<WH995> unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced<WH3198> Job<WH347>, or that answered<WH6030> his words<WH561>:
Lest ye should say<WH559>, We have found out<WH4672> wisdom<WH2451>: God<WH410> thrusteth him down<WH5086>, not man<WH376>.
Now he hath not directed<WH6186> his words<WH4405> against me: neither will I answer<WH7725> him with your speeches<WH561>. directed: or, ordered
They were amazed<WH2865>, they answered<WH6030> no more: they left off<WH6275> speaking<WH4405>. left: Heb. removed speeches from themselves
When I had waited<WH3176>, (for they spake<WH1696> not, but stood still<WH5975>, and answered<WH6030> no more;)
I said, I will answer<WH6030> also my part<WH2506>, I also will shew<WH2331> mine opinion<WH1843>.
For I am full<WH4390> of matter<WH4405>, the spirit<WH7307> within<WH990> me constraineth<WH6693> me. matter: Heb. words spirit: Heb. spirit of my belly
Behold, my belly<WH990> is as wine<WH3196> which hath no vent<WH6605>; it is ready to burst<WH1234> like new<WH2319> bottles<WH178>. hath: Heb. is not opened
I will speak<WH1696>, that I may be refreshed<WH7304>: I will open<WH6605> my lips<WH8193> and answer<WH6030>. be: Heb. breathe
Let me not, I pray you, accept<WH5375> any man's<WH376> person<WH6440>, neither let me give flattering titles<WH3655> unto man<WH120>.
For I know<WH3045> not to give flattering titles<WH3655>; in so doing my maker<WH6213> would soon<WH4592> take me away<WH5375>.
